result.title: Preliminary report on performance specifications of the microscopes
result.description: First report on the performance specifications of the available microscopes. This will include, among others: optical resolution, operation times, light intensity and homogeneity, spectral compostion and electrical operation specifications.

result.title: Report on undertaken communications activities
result.description: This deliverable will report the undertaken actions for the communication and dissemination of the project’s outcomes. These include: • Dissemination of results via publications in high impact journals and participation to international workshops/conferences. • Dissemination of VISORSURF results with companies/SMEs. • Participation to any clustering activities related with the VISORSURF’s subject, such as activities within the FETOPEN program (e.g. the annual FETOPEN conference) and activities of the Metamorphose Virtual Institute of Metamaterials • Appearing in digital & public media, such as YouTube, the press & newsletters. • The publication of a book on HSF foundations, design methods and best manufacturing practices. • Organizing summer schools and special sessions at venues on HSF and related subjects. • Invite experts from the consulting committee and beyond to participate to project meetings.

result.title: Measurements-based HSF monitoring system design
result.description: This deliverable will seek network measurement-based ways to monitor the state of the controller network in real-time and “debug” a HSF program. Both microscopic (direct query to specific nodes) and macroscopic (aggregate metrics) methodologies will be considered, studying their potential trade-offs.

result.title: Initial UML definition of the HSF programming interface and virtual functions
result.description: This deliverable will provide the initial Unified Modelling Language description of the HSF programming interface. It will define the basic programming methods that the HSF should support, and link them at a high level to the intended virtual (metasurface) functionality that they should yield.
